alert.note: Alert for Bennington (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 20 at 12:01AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Saratoga, southern Washington, northeastern Rensselaer and southwestern Bennington Counties through 1245 AM EDT... At 1159 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of Mechanicville, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds up tp 30 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rains could cause ponding of water on roadways and poor drainage flooding. Locations impacted include... Bennington, Hoosick Falls, Arlington, Shaftsbury, Cambridge, Greenwich, Lee, White Creek, Easton, Stillwater, North Bennington, Woodford, Old Bennington, Glastenbury, Deans Corners, Center White Creek, Hoosick Junction, Paper Mill Village, Sodom and Chiselville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized poor drainage flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
